intro: Prevostea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered prevostea, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
